channel.title: Issue 027 – Luna Station Quarterly
channel.description: Stellar Short Fiction by Women-Identified Writers Since 2010

item.title: Issue 027 is live!
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Lyn Parsons
item.description: Hi everyone! Just your friendly neighborhood editor-in-chief here to announce that our latest issue is…
item.content:encoded:
Hi everyone! Just your friendly neighborhood editor-in-chief here to announce that our latest issue is ready for your enjoyment!

In this issue, there’s our usual editorial to kick things off. This time aroundÂ I talk about something very important to me: the need for uplift.

We also have an assortment of amazing stories, including our featured tale, “When the Moon Fell Down” by L. Lark.

As with every issue this year, we’re proud and thrilled once again to feature the fabulous artwork of Sara Kipin and another of her Lady Knights.

I must say, the issue looks great online, but the print edition? FABULOUS. Want one? Details are on the Issue page or you can become a Patron and get one delivered to you automatically!

So please to go and read a story now. If you enjoy it and want to support it and LSQ, definitely share it!
